revised_title: Transport Processes in Liquids: A Modern Theory and Its Applications
tldr: This article discusses the modern theory of transport processes in liquids, focusing on the average flow of mass, momentum, and energy. The author explains how the probability distribution for the coordinates and momenta of molecules can be used to derive transport coefficients like viscosity and thermal conductivity. The theory is applied to monatomic liquids and electrolytes, providing a better understanding of their behavior and properties.
